Templates help define the layout of the: Templates help define the layout of the site. You can customise all aspects of your posts and pages using blocks and patterns in this editor.
Disable blocks that you don't want to ap: Disable blocks that you don't want to appear in the inserter. They can always be toggled back on later.
Customize how you interact with blocks i: Customise how you interact with blocks in the block library and editing canvas.
Customize options related to the block e: Customise options related to the block editor interface and editing flow.
Review settings, such as visibility and: Review settings, such as visibility and tags.
Describe the purpose of the template, eg "Full Width". Custom templates can be applied to any post or page.
Give the template a title that indicates: Give the template a title that indicates its purpose, eg "Full Width".
Are you sure you want to delete the %s t: Are you sure you want to delete the %s template? It may be used by other pages or posts.
Custom template created. You're in templ: Custom template created. You're in template mode now.
Editing template. Changes made here affe: Editing template. Changes made here affect all posts and pages that use the template.
Shows block breadcrumbs at the bottom of: Shows block breadcrumbs at the bottom of the editor.

Highlights the current block and fades o: Highlights the current block and fades other content.
Compacts options and outlines in the too: Compacts options and outlines in the toolbar.
Aids screen readers by stopping text car: Aids screen readers by stopping text caret from leaving blocks.
Places the most frequent blocks in the b: Places the most frequent blocks in the block library.

Learn how to use the block editor: Learn how to use the block editor
All of the blocks available to you live: All of the blocks available to you live in the block library. You’ll find it wherever you see the <InserterIconImage /> icon.
Get to know the block library: Get to know the block library
Each block comes with its own set of con: Each block comes with its own set of controls for changing things like colour, width and alignment. These will show and hide automatically when you have a block selected.
In the WordPress editor, each paragraph,: In the WordPress editor, each paragraph, image or video is presented as a distinct “block” of content.
A page reload is required for this chang: A page reload is required for this change. Make sure your content is saved before reloading.
